subject: Programming
title: Communication Overhead
description: A quick, practical guide to Communication Overhead.

hook.text: Add one person to a team of five and you add five new communication channels. Complexity explodes.

buildup.text: Brooks showed that communication paths grow as n times n minus one divided by two. It's quadratic.

discovery.text: Small teams communicate faster because everyone knows what everyone else is doing.

twist.text: Remote work multiplied communication cost. Without hallway chats, alignment requires deliberate effort.

climax.text: The best teams invest in clear documentation, async updates, and structured meetings to reduce overhead.

punchline.text: More people means more talking, not more building.
